subject: Climate & Environment
title: Wildfire Smoke and Air Quality
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Wildfire Smoke and Air Quality.

hook.text: In 2023, Canadian wildfire smoke turned New York City's sky orange and its air toxic.

buildup.text: Wildfire smoke contains fine particles, carbon monoxide, and toxic chemicals from burned material.

discovery.text: PM2.5 particles from smoke penetrate deep into lungs and enter the bloodstream.

twist.text: Smoke can travel thousands of kilometers. Fires in Siberia degrade air quality in Alaska.

climax.text: Wildfire smoke now affects more people than the fires themselves â€” a growing global health crisis.

punchline.text: You don't need to live near a fire to breathe one.

quiz.question: How far can wildfire smoke travel?
